intro: Rhexia calcarata, commonly known as the pinkroot or sandroot, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink to magenta flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a distinctive underground tuberous root system, which gives it its common name. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy appearance. Rhexia calcarata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in sandy or loamy habitats.
